reviews.review_content:
David is a very open-minded, informed, and thoughtful instructor.  He knows a huge amount about techniques and materials and how to use them traditionally and non-traditionally.  He takes his students' work seriously, and is generally supportive-- occasionally, in my opinion, too generous.  However, his criticism remains very perceptive and focused.  He doesn't try to push a stylistic or conceptual agenda unlike some professors here, yet he can respond with clarity to many approaches.  He is also sort of hilarious... in a tucked-in shirt jazz-cat stoner style.  In his humble way, he is one of the best art professors I've had (which says a lot).  
Workload:
self-directed
